definitions.definition: The name of a film, musical piece, painting , or other work of art .
The name of a writing such as a book, which identifies it and usually describes its subject , with a short phrase that often summarizes its topic.

examples: The retailer carries thousands of titles .
Buyers of the new video game console can choose from three bundled titles .

definitions.definition: A section or division of a writing, as of an act of law or a book.
examples: Title II of the USA PATRIOT Act
I know the singer's name, but not the title of the song.

definitions.definition: An appellation given to a person or family to signify either veneration , official position , social rank , the possession of assets or properties , or a professional or academic qualification ; a style. (For examples, see :Category:en:Titles .)
Legal right to ownership of a property; a deed or other certificate proving this.
examples: a good title to an estate, or an imperfect title

definitions.definition: In canon law, that by which a beneficiary holds a benefice .
A church to which a priest was ordained , and where he was to reside .
A written title, credit , or caption shown with a film, video, or performance.
examples: The titles scrolled by too quickly to read.

definitions.definition: The recognition given to the winner of a championship in sports.
The panel for the name, between the bands of the back of a book.

main_definition: The name of a film, musical piece, painting , or other work of art .
secondary_definitions: The name of a writing such as a book, which identifies it and usually describes its subject , with a short phrase that often summarizes its topic.
( by extension ) A section or division of a writing, as of an act of law or a book.

An appellation given to a person or family to signify either veneration , official position , social rank , the possession of assets or properties , or a professional or academic qualification ; a style. (For examples, see :Category:en:Titles .)
( property law ) Legal right to ownership of a property; a deed or other certificate proving this.
In canon law, that by which a beneficiary holds a benefice .
A church to which a priest was ordained , and where he was to reside .
( chiefly in the plural ) A written title, credit , or caption shown with a film, video, or performance.
( sports ) The recognition given to the winner of a championship in sports.
( bookbinding ) The panel for the name, between the bands of the back of a book.
